highlights.title: Biologics design
highlights.description: (i) Design of mini-proteins and antibodies for multiple therapy areas using Rosetta and AlphaFold / RFDiffusion / ProteinMPNN pipelines (ii) SAR analysis based on protein language models. (iii) Optimizing non-canonical modifications to peptides for half-life protraction.

highlights.title: Scientific software development
highlights.description: Worked closely with AWS to re-tool AlphaFold and deploy a faster cloud-native in-house version for robust and scalable (~100k sequences) structure prediction; reguarly applied now in variant design within the company.

highlights.title: Leadership
highlights.description: (i) Program lead for refining protein interface prediction ML models in collaboration with the Institute for Protein Design at UW, Seattle. (ii) Led and evaulated a proof of concept for onboarding virtual reality based structural rendering software among collaborative teams of computational design scientists and synthetic chemists.

work.company: Department of Bioengineering, University of California San Francisco

highlights.title: Protein structure modeling using chemical crosslinks
highlights.description: Homology models + chemical-crosslinks + cryo-EM data for protein complex structure modeling; graph sampling methods to extract domain information from crosslinks. Applications include SMC and DNA helicase protein families.

highlights.title: Nanobody biophsyics
highlights.description: Developed integrative docking scores for nanobody docking on target receptors (SARS-CoV-2 and variant spike proteins) using chemical crosslinking and escape mutation data. Developed design principles for increasing nanobody thermostability.

highlights.title: Whole cell models
highlights.description: Developed Bayesian Network models to combine continuum scale (pharmacokinetic), particle scale (Brownian dynamics) and network scale (enzyme pathways) models of the pancreatic beta-cell into build a proof-of-concept multimodal digitial twin. Served as software lead within the Pancreatic Beta-Cell consortium (collaborating across UCSF, USC, ShanghaiTech and HUJI)

work.company: Chemical Engineering, University of California Santa Barbara

highlights.title: Coarse-graining algorithms for bulk liquids
highlights.description: Introduced the local density potential for structurally and thermodynamically accurate coarse-grained MD simulations of liquid-liquid phase separation, which are relatively rare in the chemical engineering literature

highlights.title: Coarse-graining algorithms for protein folding using variational inference techniques
highlights.description: Developed protein backbone models for (i) template-free folding of 200+ residue coarse-grained protein domains using MD simulations, and (ii) studying self-assembly in amyloidogenic peptides

highlights.title: High Performance Computing
highlights.description: As system administrator, set up 144 core Linux (Rocks 6.2) cluster and wrote utilities for automating (i) network-attached-storage management, and (ii) conflict-free compute resource sharing between lab members.
